column2: MARYLAND DMV TEST
column4: Maryland
column6: MD

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column2: 2. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: No.
column6: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 3. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column4: if you dont feel drowsy.
column6: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 4. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 5. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 6. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.

column2: 7. When you see a funeral procession:
column4: you must pass the procession on the right on a multiple lane highway.
column6: you must yield the right-of-way to any vehicles in the procession.
column8: wait for a gap in the funeral procession to proceed.

column2: 8. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the solid line may pass.
column6: next to the broken line may pass.

column2: 9. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column6: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 10. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.
column6: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.
column8: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: You must travel at the speed indicated
column6: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions

column2: 12. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 13. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column6: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column8: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 14. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column6: Turn on your emergency lights.

column2: 15. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column4: Edge line
column6: Arrows

column2: 16. Aggressive driving behaviors can include:
column4: a tendency to drive slow.
column6: erratic lane changes.

column2: 17. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column6: delay near it.
column8: cut abruptly in front of it.

column2: 18. Continuous hard braking on ice and snow often:
column4: is the best option during winter.
column6: causes the front wheels to lock.

column2: 19. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: increase your speed immediately.
column8: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 20. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: drive fast to let off steam.
column6: listen to loud music while driving.
column8: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.

column2: 21. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
column4: pass red lights.
column6: exceed the speed limit

column2: 22. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: cross the tracks.
column6: signal the train to stop.
column8: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 23. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column6: Apply the parking brake slowly.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: Merging traffic
column6: Lane shifting

column2: 25. To make a proper right turn:
column4: swing to the left before turning right.
column6: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.
column8: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.
